title: Mr Boukadoum on a working visit to Cameroon
text: At the invitation of his Cameroonian counterpart, Mr Lejeune Mbella Mbella, the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Mr Sabri Boukadoum, paid a working visit to the Republic of Cameroon on March 24, 2021.

Mr Boukadoum was received in audience by President Paul Biya, to whom he conveyed the fraternal greetings from the President of the Republic, Mr Abdelmadjid Tebboune, as well as his will to strengthen bilateral relations and consolidate traditions of consultation on regional and international issues of common interest.

In addition, the Minister had talks with his Cameroonian counterpart, Mr Lejeune Mbella Mbella, on the state of bilateral relations and the prospects for their consolidation. On this occasion, the two Ministers signed a Memorandum of Understanding for the strengthening of political consultations between the two countries.

The situations in Libya, Western Sahara, Mali, and the Sahel, Lake Chad Basin and Central Africa regions were also on the agenda. The two Heads of Diplomacy stressed the need to increase efforts to promote African solutions to Africaâ€™s problems.
